ldap_server.name: LDAP server URL or host
ldap_server.description: Examples: ldap://dc1.example.com:389 or ldaps://dc1.example.com:636. If LDAPS is enabled below, 636 is used by default.

bind_user.name: Bind user (DN/UPN)
bind_user.description: User used for directory lookup/bind, e.g. ha-bind-user@example.com or CN=ha-bind-user,OU=Service Accounts,DC=example,DC=com.

bind_password.name: Bind password
bind_password.description: Password for the bind user. Stored in add-on options.

user_base_dn.name: User Base DN
user_base_dn.description: Base DN to search for users, e.g. OU=Users,DC=example,DC=com.

groups_base_dn.name: Groups Base DN
groups_base_dn.description: Base DN where your security groups live, e.g. OU=Groups,DC=example,DC=com.

user_group.name: Required user group (CN)
user_group.description: CN of the group required for access, e.g. HA-Users.

admin_group.name: Admin group (CN)
admin_group.description: CN of the group that grants Home Assistant admin role.

enable_ldaps.name: Enable LDAPS (TLS on port 636)
enable_ldaps.description: Turn on LDAP over SSL/TLS. Keep disabled to use plain LDAP.

ldaps_verify.name: Verify server certificate
ldaps_verify.description: Recommended. When enabled, the DC certificate will be validated against the CA below.

ldaps_ca_path.name: CA file path (optional)
ldaps_ca_path.description: Path to the CA file inside HA, e.g. /ssl/ad_root_ca.pem. Read-only mapping is provided.

ldaps_ca_pem.name: CA certificate (PEM) paste box
ldaps_ca_pem.description: Paste the root/intermediate CA in PEM format, including BEGIN/END lines. Use either this field or the CA file path.
